section.name: MathTool Reference Documentation
section.p: Tool for performing floating point math in Velocity.

ul.li: Most methods return numbers wrapped as Double which automatically render the decimal places even for whole numbers (e.g. new Double(1).toString() -> '1.0'). This is intentional. This tool is for floating point arithmetic. Integer arithmetic is already supported by the Velocity template language. If you really need '1' instead of '1.0', just call intValue() on the result.

No null pointer, number format, or divide by zero exceptions are thrown here. This is because such exceptions halt template rendering. It should be sufficient debugging feedback that Velocity will render the reference literally. (e.g. $math.div(1, 0) renders as '$math.div(1, 0)')
Class java.lang.Math is used to perform the mathematical operations.

method.name: add()

parameters.parameter: Operands of the addition. Valid input is any number (primitive types or objects, Velocity automatically converts primitives types to objects) or a string representation of a number.

method.returns: A java.lang.Double representing the sum or null if the input paramters are not valid.

parameters.parameter: Operands of the subtraction. Valid input is any number (primitive types or objects, Velocity automatically converts primitives types to objects) or a string representation of a number.

method.returns: A java.lang.Double representing the result of the subtraction or null if the input paramters are not valid.

parameters.parameter: Factors of the multiplication. Valid input is any number (primitive types or objects, Velocity automatically converts primitives types to objects) or a string representation of a number.

method.returns: A java.lang.Double representing the result of the multiplication or null if the input paramters are not valid.

method.returns: A java.lang.Double representing the first number raised to the power of the second or null if the input paramters are not valid.

parameters.parameter: Operands. Valid input is any number (primitive types or objects, Velocity automatically converts primitives types to objects) or a string representation of a number.

method.returns: A java.lang.Double representing the maximum of the two numbers or null if the input paramters are not valid.

method.name: max()

parameters.parameter: Operand. Valid input is any number (primitive types or objects, Velocity automatically converts primitives types to objects) or a string representation of a number.

method.returns: A java.lang.Double representing the absolute value of the input or null if the input paramter is not valid.

method.name: toDouble()
method.abstract: Converts a number into a double.

parameters.parameter: Operand. Valid input is any number (primitive types or objects, Velocity automatically converts primitives types to objects) or a string representation of a number.

method.returns: A java.lang.Double representing the input number or null if the input paramter is not valid.

method.name: toInteger()
method.abstract: Converts a number into an integer

parameters.parameter: Operand. Valid input is any number (primitive types or objects, Velocity automatically converts primitives types to objects) or a string representation of a number.

method.returns: A java.lang.Integer representing the input number or null if the input paramter is not valid.

method.name: roundTo()
method.abstract: Rounds a number to the specified number of decimal places

parameters.parameter: The number of decimal places. Valid input is any number (primitive types or objects, Velocity automatically converts primitives types to objects) or a string representation of a number.
The number to round. Valid input is any number (primitive types or objects, Velocity automatically converts primitives types to objects) or a string representation of a number.

method.returns: A java.lang.Double representing the input number rounded to the specified number of decimal places or null if the input paramter is not valid.

description.p: This method is particulary useful for simple display formatting. If you want to round an number to the nearest integer, it is better to use method roundToInt(), as that will return an java.lang.Integer rather than a java.lang.Double.

method.name: roundToInt()
method.abstract: Rounds a number to the nearest whole Integer

parameters.parameter: The number to round. Valid input is any number (primitive types or objects, Velocity automatically converts primitives types to objects) or a string representation of a number.

method.returns: A java.lang.Integer representing the input number rounded to nearest whole Integer or null if the input paramter is not valid.

method.name: getRandom()
method.returns: A java.lang.Double greater than or equal to 0.0 and less than 1.0.

method.name: random()
method.abstract: Returns a pseudo-random number in a configurable range

parameters.parameter: First and last number of range. Valid input is any number (primitive types or objects, Velocity automatically converts primitives types to objects) or a string representation of a number.

method.returns: A java.lang.Integer greater than or equal to the first number and less than the second number or null if the input paramter is not valid.
